meanings.definition: The quality of being binding or obligatory.
meanings.sent1: The bindingness of the contract ensured both parties followed the rules.
meanings.sent2: The bindingness of the agreement made it legally enforceable.
meanings.sent3: The bindingness of the promise brought a sense of trust between them.
meanings.sent4: The bindingness of the decision weighed heavily on their minds.
meanings.sent5: The bindingness of the oath was as strong as steel.

meanings.definition: The state of being securely fastened or attached.
meanings.sent1: The bindingness of the rope kept the boat in place.
meanings.sent2: The bindingness of the knot ensured the package wouldn't come loose.
meanings.sent3: The bindingness of the velcro made it easy to open and close.
meanings.sent4: The bindingness of the handcuffs restricted his movement.
meanings.sent5: The bindingness of the glue held the pieces together firmly.

meanings.definition: The ability to create a strong emotional or moral connection.
meanings.sent1: The bindingness of their friendship was evident in times of need.
meanings.sent2: The bindingness of the story resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent3: The bindingness of the song brought tears to their eyes.
meanings.sent4: The bindingness of the tradition linked generations together.
meanings.sent5: The bindingness of the bond was unbreakable.
